message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper focuses on the security aspect of wireless sensor networks and specifically deals with eavesdropping attacks and intercept probability analysis. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with wireless sensor networks and their communication protocols, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
3. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper uses information-theoretic concepts such as channel capacity and secrecy capacity to analyze the security of wireless transmissions. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes an optimal sensor scheduling scheme to protect the wireless transmission against eavesdropping attacks, which falls under the scope of control systems. 
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - Although not the primary focus, the paper mentions the impact of wireless fading on the quality of multimedia transmissions in industrial environments.
